As I have said earlier; @GenerativeDng is excellent game   from what I have seen and played around with.

5/5

But what do I know, I'm just an "competitor" and not at all interested in changing the way game devs can release assets through decentralized mediums. https://t.co/uGelAVNKgz

4/5

As you how no option at all to keep it persistent or immutable how does it differ from anything in Web 2.0? With IPFS you can at least pin the asset yourself to keep it persisted to your NFT.

3/5

By hosting it on decentralized servers and having the interaction through smart contract (and not changes on a regular centralized api) is what makes it an on chain playable NFT.
If the group of people in charge of the project can change assets at anytime or loose your data.

2/5

There is literally no difference other than accepting crypto as currency when you have centralized game, api and servers controlled by a set of people running the project than how online games function today.
